startFire: Used t' start a fire. Use on campfires, furnaces, etc. t' light them or on an empty tile. Usin' this action may require kindlin', tinder and a fuel item in yer duffle dependin' on th' circumstance.
carve: Used t' carve creature corpses or t' remove doodads attached t' th' ground.
setDown: Usin' this item will place it on top o' whatever tile be present in yer facin' direction. This be different than just droppin' th' item.
eat: Consumed on use. May provide benefits t' hunger, thirst, health and stamina; however, may reduce them as well dependin' on th' food.
drinkItem: Consumed on use. Will reduce yer thirst; however, will provide negative effects when drinkin' sea/unpurified water.
rest: Used t' rest fer a period o' time t' regain health and stamina. Ye will belay restin' when reachin' full stamina.
sleep: Used t' sleep fer a period o' time t' regain health and stamina. Duration be based on campin' skill and time o' day. A bonus t' all effects (includin' length) will be granted if facin' a fire or lit doodad. Hunger and dehydration increase slower while sleepin'.
heal: Consumed on use. Used t' restore a varied amount o' health.
dig: Used t' dn' up resources and items from th' ground.
paddle: Used t' travel over water without gettin' yer feet wet. Yer speed be not reduced in water while paddlin'.
gatherWater: Used t' gather water into th' container.
shoot: Ye can shoot arrows with this item.
cast: Come across a fish in a body o' water and attempt t' cast yer line or net t' catch it.
traverseTheSea: Used t' travel t' new, unexplored lands, leavin' behind yer current surroundings.
sling: Ye can slin' bullets with this item.
repair: Used fer repairin' items t' increase their minimum durability at th' cost o' some maximum durability.
decode: Used fer attemptin' t' read a map. Use by th' booty location t' reveal how far or close ye be.
learn: Readin' books can provide useful knowledge.
reinforce: Consumed on use. Used t' increase th' overall maximum and minimum durability o' an item.
gather: Can be used directly t' gather from an adjacent resource tile/doodad. Gatherin' will attempt t' gather everythin', destroyin' th' plant or mushroom in th' process.
stokeFire: Used on a fire source t' increase th' strength o' th' flame.
pour: Pour on fire t' extinguish th' flames, inside a water still t' begin water filtration, on a suitable plant t' increase its health, or just simply just empty it out.
plant: Attempts t' plant th' item on th' tile ye be facin' towards. Some plants may require certain ground types or conditions t' be planted.
gatherTreasure: Attempt t' gather a booty in th' vicinity o' use based on a decoded treasure map. Range o' gather be dependent on yer minin' skill.
ignite: Use this item on a fire source t' start it on fire.
build: Attempt t' construct or assemble th' item on th' tile ye be facin'.
openContainer: Usin' this will open it whar ye may move items t' and from. Weight reduction and decay reduction bonuses may apply t' items inside.
preserve: Used with food items t' extend their life and decay rate.
openBottle: Consumed on use. Usin' this will open it, providin' new and unknown items.
drinkCure: Consumed on use. Used t' cure poisonin' while sometimes providin' other health benefits.
tellTime: Used t' measure th' time o' day or night.
sailToCivilization: After collectin' all th' pieces o' booty, ye can return t' civilization and bask in th' glory o' yer swag and fame. Ye can always return back t' these lands afterwards.
transmogrify: Used t' infuse an item with magical properties and increased durability.
fire: Usin' a mixture o' black powder alon' with a bullet, ye may fire this weapon.
teleport: With a flick o' th' wand, teleport t' a location in front o' whar ye be facin'.
extinguish: Douse th' torch, extinguishin' th' flame.
drawMap: Draw a map usin' yer skill in cartography o' th' surroundin' area.
pourOnYourself: Liquid be consumed on use. Used t' sooth burn injuries.
squeeze: Consumed on use. Spews a stream o' fire in yer facin' direction.
healOther: Consumed on use. Used t' restore a varied amount o' health t' a creature or human entity.
rubClockwise: Rubbin' this item manifests its effects t' th' holder.
rubCounterclockwise: Rubbin' this item manifests its effects t' th' holder.
grasp: Used t' loot items usin' another item fer safety reasons such as graspin' items in a fire.
till: Use while facin' a tile ye wish t' till, grantin' it properties fer better plant growth.
harvest: Can be used t' harvest an adjacent plant or mushroom without destroyin' th' plant itself, harvestin' just th' produce.
gatherMilk: Attempt t' gather milk from a creature ye be facin'.
read: Open th' book and read th' contents.
smotherFire: Usin' this will extinguish fires as well as cover th' facin' tile with this item.
placeDown: Place th' item down t' th' adjacent tile so it can be used on th' ground instead o' directly from yer duffle.
apply: Consumed on use. Used t' apply t' yer skin t' provide protection or treatment t' injuries or ailments.
hitch: Used when facin' a creature that be adjacent t' a hitchin' post t' force th' creature t' stay put.
unhitch: Used when facin' a creature that be hitched t' free them.
attachContainer: Used t' attach th' container t' a doodad ye be facin'.
refine: Used t' refine crafted items t' reduce their overall weight.
testDepth: Used when facin' a well t' test th' depth and water type o' a well by lowerin' th' rope down.
enchant: Used t' enhance an item, increasin' its quality or modifyin' its magical properties.
navigate: Used t' find yer coordinates by lookin' into th' horizon and measurin'  distances.
melee: Attempt t' melee attack a creature ye be facin'.

islandPresence:
"This island seems t' react t' me presence. I often have a weird feelin', like somethin' be watchin' me, but besides th' constant barrage o' bloodthirsty creatures at me heels, that feelin' ne'er leaves me; it follows me even into me dreams. I'm not sure how many more sleepless nights I can lead."

"Thar it be again. I felled a tree. I hear it."

"Thar it be again. I burned a tree. Th' hummin' continues."

"Thar it be again, th' end. I started a forest fire. It's too loud!"

Th' next pages have undecipherable scribbles and diagrams.
treasures:
"Th' greed that has driven us t' these islands now forces us t' stay here. Day after day we search fer th' treasures that brought us t' these lands t' begin with. Our group o' men have discovered several different types o' booty, some even from slayin' th' ravenous indigenous creatures that seem t' roam these islands and caves. But we cannot seem t' leave, we need more. Th' island demands it."

Th' next pages seem t' be ripped out and missin'.

"We have failed. Many have perished. We be missin' th' final piece. I do not think we can make it much further. We seem t' have angered nature itself."
deities:
"Th' same three strange symbols seem t' appear again and again on artifacts, cave walls, and even old lon'-ago abandoned buildings. Cross referencin' other resources and even some older journals we have found references t' deities, spirits, and even Gods. Most likely worshiped by th' heathens that used t' inhabit these lands. They seem connected t' these islands somehow."

"Th' three names seem t' be mentioned again and again, Wry, Da, and Aw."
pastCivilizations:
"We have discovered evidence o' many battles here. Not only that, but civilizations, skeletal remains, abandoned houses, and much evidence t' support some type o' apocalyptic scenario."

"Not only that, but it seems t' happen again and again; th' evidence all points t' different ages and different points in time. It appears as though no people be able t' survive and thrive in these lands, like some force be forbiddin' human progress."

"These ravenous, unabatin' creatures be not helpin' matters, that's fer sure."
sandCasting:
Th' entire book seems t' be stained with various chemicals and powders.

"Throughout me metallurgic experiments, I have found th' best way t' forge iron based tools, weapons, and ingots was t' cast large amounts o' material t' shape it. Th' best castin' method I have found usin' resources aroun' me was sand castin'."

"Th' primary ingredient fer creatin' a sand cast be green sand, a mixture o' clay flakes and refined sand. This allows fer th' malleability o' creatin' th' shape o' tool and weapon heads, or even formin' th' ingots in which t' work from."

"Next, we place th' green sand in a flask, crafted with wood, holystone, rock, or raw clay, finishin' th' build o' th' sand cast flask. We then set th' shape, place down some talc powder so th' finished produce can be lifted easier, and pour th' molten smelted mixture into th' cast t' let it set and harden."

Th' book be adorned with crude drawings o' each process.

"I have also found I can use limestone powder as th' flux t' refine ores and remove impurities in th' smeltin' process. Some carbon powder be also required t' get a proper hardness t' th' finished metal."

Th' bottom o' th' paged be signed with "James Townsend, th' Smithy".
wanderingMerchants:
"Throughout me exploration o' th' island, I have run across other people, much t' me surprise. It appears as they were in a similar state as myself; somehow trapped in these lands, strugglin' fer our lives. In th' many cases, these folks were not hostile, and we smartly made friendships."

"We traded goods and spoke on our situation. One o' th' folks drove a very hard bargain fer some limestone that I needed. If I was a different type o' person, given our secluded settin', I may have simply just taken it through "other means"."

"Although it was always me intent t' return t' them fer tradin', try as I might, I could no longer locate them. Either they moved on t' other areas or died. Given th' circumstances o' these harsh lands, I'm guessin' th' latter be true."
trappersJournal:
"Usin' techniques and skills me father taught t' me in me youth, I was successfully able t' ward off th' monstrosities usin' traps. Th' snare and th' deadfall become me most useful weapons."

"I spent days craftin' traps and placin' them outside me shelter instead o' focusin' on traditional weaponry. My combat skills be not so great, and I have not found a meaningful resource t' craft armor, so trappin' appeared t' be me best bet t' dispatch these creatures."

"I think I just heard me deadfall squish another giant spider. I'll write more on me improvised spider meat meal. Sadly, cookin' be not me forte either."
theForce:
"I'm not sure if I can properly explain this. Maybe if I ever see ye in person again, I can walk ye through it. I can show it t' ye if ye have not yet experienced it. I hope that day comes. Sadly, I fear that shall not be th' case."

"Thar be a presence here. It's a force. A force that bends things t' its will. It preys on me malevolence. I know I sound mad, but I'm sure o' this."

"I have dispatched o' many helpless creatures here. Not me proudest moments t' be sure. That force be th' strongest in those times. Th' times whar I push myself over that perilous moral edge and indulge in me very nature. Th' nature o' us all. T' fight, t' kill, t' dominate."

"And yet, th' force wanes as I tend t' me crops and as I slay th' evil things that roam here."

"Maybe thar be no force, and this be just a manifestation o' guilt. My abject want o' a rejection o' progress and t' live a peaceful existence."

"I hope I can see ye again. In this life or th' next."

"Yer lovin' sister, Margaret."
islandRiddle:
"I cultivated th' land"

"And dominated over nature"

"Th' destitute I remand"

"Through heinous legislature"

"Gaze at me wonderful structures"

"As I tax th' poor"

"Losin' me deep-rooted culture"

"Sacrificed fer th' allure"

"I am destined t' rise and destined t' fall"

"With an inevitable destruction t' mankind and all"
trapped:
"One would assume I would be able t' make it back home, or at least a bit further from these islands. But try as I might with this ramshackle raft, I am unable t' get very far. I somehow always lose me bearin'. Th' horizon becomes unclear and me surroundings blurry. Next thin' ye know, I am somehow turned aroun', loopin' back t' th' west as I travel east, or back t' south as I travel north."

"I am unable t' explain this."

"Perhaps a faster and better constructed vessel might be a safer idea fer traversin' these strange seas."

Th' rest o' th' book be water damaged and most o' th' writin' be illegible.
powderyCatalog:
"Th' cornerstone t' some godforsaken recipe worth its weight be a powder o' some kind. A must have tool fer some godforsaken wayward wanderer be a mortar and pestle. Grind away and ye may discover a use fer somethin' ye may have not considered."

"Things be so much more than they seem. Turn them into a powder and ye open up so many new possibilities!"

Th' book describes in detail with markings and illustrations o' each powder type cataloged.

1. "Bone meal from bones. Fer use with fertilizer and fertile soil t' provide nutrients t' plants."
2. "Flour from wheat. Used in bakin' goods."
3. "Copal resin from copal. Melted down and used t' reinforce items."
4. "Tannin from tree bark. Used fer tannin' and leatherworkin' endeavors."
5. "Refined Sand from beach or desert sand. Likely useful fer glass and makin' o' greensand fer sand castin'."
6. "Talcum powder from talc. T' aid in removin' casted material from sand casts."
7. "Limestone powder from limestone. Used as a flux when smeltin' raw ore."
8. "Carbon powder from charcoal. Further refines and increases th' quality o' resultin' metal when smeltin' ore."

"My fascinations with powders elude me. Perhaps I was a chemist in another life?"
onWaterAndHydration:
"There’s water in th' ground."
"There’s water in th' cave."
"If I go thirsty."
"I’ll soon come across me grave."
"There’s water in th' well."
"There’s water in th' sea."
"Shall I go thirsty?"
"We shall very well see."

"Water be found in many places, but not all forms be safe t' drink. Take fer example yer ne'er-endin' horizontal surroundin'; th' sea. It would be so easy if ye were able t' drink th' salty brine, but even in a dire situation, it can often be deadly. It will cause distress t' yer insides and make ye even thirstier. What type o' gods found delight in such a thin'?"

"Thar be a workaround, however. Constructin' a still will allow ye t' desalinate th' water by distillin' it. Boilin' th' water fer lon' periods o' time will cause th' filtered steam t' collect in a separate vessel, resultin' in nearly pure water. Show those gods what for!"

"Or perhaps ye can come across water on land. Water be commonly found in swampy areas and near rocks, especially in high elevation areas whar snow may form. Snow be water after all! Water be also commonly abundant in subterranean caves. These forms o' water may be safe t' drink, but it’s always a good idea t' boil fresh water. This will require a fire source. Diggin' can also sometimes provide hidden underground water, especially near other bodies o' pre-existin' water like ponds and lakes."

"Fer th' more industrious type, ye may fancy a well. Wells will be able t' accumulate rain and ground water, although not all terrain be suitable fer their construction. Findin' a ground water source may be taxin' on resources, especially when ye be not able t' map some godforsaken subterranean passages below."

"So ye see, water be everywhere, ye just need t' know whar t' look."

Th' book ends with a signed name, "Henry Cliffe".

slime: A bouncin' globule o' animated gelatin. It be not aware o' yer stirrin'.
jellyCube: An animated cube o' gelatin. Its body jiggles to-and-fro as it moves towards ye with hostile intent.
giantSpider: A gangly, frightful arachnid with th' ability t' poison ye.
bear: A hulkin' carnivorous mammal attracted t' yer scent. A deadly foe without protection.
rabbit: A fast movin', peaceful herbivorous mammal. Useful fer a good meal or as a pet.
snake: A slitherin', poisonous reptile. Appears ambivalent t' yer encroachment.
giantRat: A rat o' unusual size with sharp claws and piercin' teeth. Keep at a distance without equipment.
rat: A small and scurryin' rodent. Afraid o' predators, it will try t' escape yer grasp.
vampireBat: A flyin' mammal with large rubbery wings. Appears t' have a penchant fer human blood.
greyWolf: A tall canid animal. Able t' tear into flesh with vicious abandon.
imp: An odd hoverin' creature with thick wrinkled skin and sharp claws.
bogling: A foul, sulphurous-smellin' writhin' mass o' vegetation, seemingly animated and alive.
livingRock: A massive pile o' rocks and minerals that appears t' be alive, or semi-aware at least.
shark: A large blood-thirsty cartilaginous sea creature. Its fin juts from th' waters, tauntin' ye.
zombie: A slow, but stron' foul-smellin' undead or diseased human. Appears t' dislike th' sun.
skeleton: An animated pile o' human, or human-like bones.
pirateGhost: A glowin', ethereal visage o' a pirate. It appears t' be able t' manifest a physical weapon t' attack ye.
timeSkitter: An unusual spider-like creature that appears t' be able t' move through solid objects and move at incredible speeds.
chicken: A flightless fowl that seems fearful o' yer presence. Produces feathers, cackle fruit, meat, and more.
trapdoorSpider: A large spider that appeared from an underground dwellin' as ye stumbled over it.
fireElemental: A creature that be seemingly composed o' only fire. Appears t' spread fire and destruction in its wake.
cod: A common ocean fish, known fer its nutritionally-dense, flaky white flesh.
hobgoblin: An odd-lookin' humanoid. Dislikes yer presence and appears t' know how t' use traps.
livingMushroom: A livin' mycological abomination. It appears t' have a vengeful attitude towards ye.
kraken: A wiry mass o' thick tentacles, this lumberin' sea-giant be angered by yer existence.
blindfish: A cave-dwellin', sightless fish. Hard t' see in detail within th' murky briny briny depths.
harpy: A large and unusual avian creature. Hostile t' yer presence.
acidSpitterDemon: A small, but fierce demonic-lookin' creature with sharp claws. Appears t' spit an acidic fluid.
skeletalMage: A robed, magic-castin' skeletal humanoid. It appears t' hold a wand; flickin' it t' cast its spells.
clawWorm: A wrigglin' creature with a massive claw-mouth, spawned forth from th' ground due t' vibrations caused by yer gatherin'.
drake: A massive flightless lizard-dragon with large scales and th' ability t' breath fire. A fearsome foe.
goat: A hardy ruminant animal that has horns. A frisky, lively creature, but dangerous when provoked, rammin' at its target with much force.
slitherSucker: A wrigglin' foreign-lookin' worm-like creature. Its mouth be wide and be filled with suction modules and razor sharp teeth.
mudskipper: A slippery fish that appears t' come t' land fer feedin'. Its bulgy eyes and a large gapin' mouth make it quite th' sight.
scorpion: A predatory arachnid, known fer its tall segmented tail and ominous stinger.
rattlesnake: A dangerous rattlin' predator o' th' desert. Th' rattlesnake warns ye with its vibratin' tail as ye pass by it.
antelopeJackrabbit: A hare with formidable speed and agility. It be visually strikin' with its pointed ears and lon' muscular frame.
redSnapper: A massive snapper lurks below; this variation be known fer its red hue and be a much sought-after game fish and food source.
walleye: A decent sized freshwater fish, known fer its olive and gold coloration and pronounced dorsal fin.
wisp: A magical glowin' orb o' ghostly blue fire, playfully movin' amon' th' trees. A rare sight indeed!

woodenDoor: A sturdy door, used t' keep unwanted creatures out.
woodenFence: A set o' panels, usually used t' keep creatures inside.
woodenWall: A wall crafted by connectin' wooden logs together.
sandstoneWall: A robust wall created from holystone.
setExplosiveTrap: An elaborate trap, ready t' be triggered and exploded by touch.
setDeadfall: A constructed deadfall, ready t' fall and crush a creature.
setSnare: A constructed snare, ready t' trap a creature's appendage.
setHobgoblinSnare: A hobgoblin constructed snare, ready t' catch yer feet or an unsuspectin' creature.
solarStill: A constructed solar still, desalinatin' water through evaporation.
woodenChest: A chest used fer stockpilin' items and preservin' food.
lockedWoodenChest: A locked chest, too heavy t' move. Able t' be broken or lockpicked.
creatureIdol: An odd mass o' organs. A hum emanates from it, seemingly attractin' creatures.
grass: A small mound o' growin' grass.
clematis: A wiry tangle o' thin vines with leaves.
milkThistles: A couple milk thistles, known fer their medicinal properties.
buttonMushrooms: A few possibly edible common-lookin' white mushrooms.
switchgrass: A collection o' lon' grass, suitable fer cordage.
badderlocks: A gatherin' o' lon' seaweed, useful fer eatin' or cordage.
chives: A bunch o' bright green chives planted in t' th' ground.
pileOfRocks: A mass o' rocks, stuck into th' ground.
raspberryBush: A small bush, bearin' small amounts o' raspberries.
beggarticks: A groupin' o' bright yellow medicinal flowers.
cotton: A white and fluffy cotton plant, an indispensable plant fer fiber.
pricklyPears: Spined cacti, known fer its edible fruit and pads with their pointy needles.
tumbleweed: A common weed, notorious fer becomin' dry and brittle after its maturity, breakin' free from its roots and travelin' in high winds, spreadin' its seeds.
stoneWaterStill: A stone water still, ready t' be lit t' desalinate water.
litStoneWaterStill: A lit stone water still, desalinatin' water through evaporation.
stoneCampfire: An organized circle o' rocks, used t' contain a fire.
litStoneCampfire: A lit fire inside an enclosure o' rocks.
sandstoneKiln: A high-temperature fire enclosure made from holystone.
litSandstoneKiln: A lit holystone kiln, ready fer firin' items.
stoneFurnace: A rock furnace fer creatin' an enclosed high-temperature fire.
litStoneFurnace: A lit stone furnance, ready t' be used in production.
poleTorchStand: A wooden pole stuck in th' ground, ready fer bein' lit t' provide illumination.
litPoleTorchStand: A wooden pole stuck in th' ground and lit on fire.
stoneAnvil: A stone anvil used primarily fer metalworkin' and used in conjunction with a fire source.
caveEntrance: An entrance into th' the dark caverns below.
woodenDoorOpen: An open door, allowin' anythin' t' enter.
woodenGateOpen: An opened gate, allowin' anythin' t' escape or enter.
poisonIvy: A creepin' plant with leaves o' three.
wroughtIronChest: A large chest, used fer storage and keepin' edibles fresher.
ironChest: An iron container fer storin' items and reducin' food decay.
ornateWoodenChest: A decorative chest used fer storin' items and preservin' perishables.
skeletalRemains: A pile o' bones that appear t' be stirrin'.
litClayKiln: A lit clay kiln, ready fer firin' items.
clayCampfire: An organized circle o' clay bricks, used t' contain a fire.
litClayCampfire: A lit fire inside an enclosure o' clay bricks.
clayFurnace: A clay furnace fer creatin' an enclosed high-temperature fire.
litClayFurnace: A lit clay furnance, ready t' be used in production.
clayWaterStill: A clay water still, ready t' be lit t' desalinate water.
litClayWaterStill: A lit clay water still, desalinatin' water through evaporation.
sandstoneCampfire: An organized circle o' holystone, used t' contain a fire.
litSandstoneCampfire: A lit fire inside an enclosure o' holystone.
sandstoneFurnace: A holystone furnace fer creatin' an enclosed high-temperature fire.
litSandstoneFurnace: A lit holystone furnance, ready t' be used in production.
sandstoneWaterStill: A holystone water still, ready t' be lit t' desalinate water.
litSandstoneWaterStill: A lit holystone water still, desalinatin' water through evaporation.
litStoneKiln: A lit stone kiln, ready fer firin' items.
wroughtIronAnvil: A wrought iron anvil, used fer blacksmithin' with a fire source.
ironAnvil: An iron anvil used fer metalworkin'. Used in addition with a fire source.
mapleTree: A common maple tree, known fer its distinctive leaf and seed shape.
appleTree: A deciduous tree known fer its sweet, pomaceous fruit; th' apple.
spruceTree: A large and robust spruce tree. Known fer its whorled branches and conical form.
cypressTree: A tall and gangly conifer tree. Although sparse in foliage, it makes up fer it with healthy supply o' hardwood.
coconutTree: A tall palm tree, able t' produce life-sustainin' coconut fruit when mature.
lettuce: An edible leafy plant that could almost be mistaken fer a weed when growin'.
potatoPlant: Unassumin' leaves pokin' out o' th' ground, revealin' just th' tips o' edible tubers underneath.
carrots: A groupin' o' green stalky leaves pokin' out o' th' ground, revealin' just th' tips o' their root vegetable below ground.
cornStalks: Th' tall stalks o' maize, producin' ears o' edible sweet kernels.
cucumberPlant: A creepin' cucumber vine, known fer producin' soft, water-rich gourds.
sugarCaneStalks: Tall, hardy stalks o' sugar cane. Can be gathered fer chewin' or refinin' into sugar.
wheat: A lon' grass, cultivated fer its protein-rich cereal grain when dried.
copperChest: A storage chest made from copper, used t' deposit food items fer reduced decay, amon' other uses.
copperAnvil: A copper anvil used fer blacksmithy. Typically used in addition with a fire source.
barkTorchStand: A bark torch placed in th' ground, ready t' be lit on fire when needed.
litBarkTorchStand: A bark torch stuck in th' ground and lit on fire, providin' illumination.
tallowTorchStand: A torch made with rendered animal fat, planted in th' ground. Can be lit on fire fer illumination.
litTallowTorchStand: A lit tallow torch lodged in th' ground, providin' light and heat.
joshuaTree: A desert tree with a distinctive look that produces leaves suitable fer cordage and nutritious fruit.
saguaroCactus: A tall and hefty cactus plant, known fer growin' in arid desert regions.
aloeVera: A succulent evergreen plant, known fer its medicinal and antiseptic properties and its sharpened thick leaves.
tallowCandle: A candle molded from tallow, placed in th' ground securely.
litTallowCandle: A lit candle, attached securely t' th' ground as it releases its light and pleasent tallow smell.
cottonBedroll: A soft sleepin' mattress, sprawled out on th' ground. Can be used t' sleep or rest very comfortably.
featherBedroll: A bedroll made with feathers and wrapped in fabric. Used fer restin' and sleepin' in comfort on th' ground.
hammock: A comfortable place t' sleep, although not too sturdy. Crafted by bound cordage and hun' off th' ground.
leafBedroll: A placed provisional bed with poor insulation and scratchy leaves, used fer sleepin' or restin'.
hitchingPost: A sturdy wooden post fastened with a rope. Creatures and animals can be tied t' it t' restrict their movement.
clayBrickWell: A constructed well made o' clay bricks, used t' collect water.
sandstoneWell: A round enclosure made o' holystone, built and extended deep into th' ground t' collect water.
stoneWell: A stone-built enclosure used t' trap and collect groundwater.

win: Ye find yer way back t' civilization and end yer journey.
Ye sail back and enjoyed a good life with yer swag.
Ye travelled back t' civilization, but be this th' end, savvy?
dead: Yer bones lay bleachin', lost t' time.
Th' end be just th' beginnin'.
Sadly, no trace o' ye was ever found.

hardcore: Th' default and definitive way t' play. Death be permanent.
casual: Dyin' will respawn ye in th' last place ye rested or slept, with yer items dropped at th' location o' yer demise. Most creatures be neutral/peaceful unless attacked.
challenge: Randomized difficulty modifiers and a unique set o' quests, intended fer quick play sessions. Savin' be disabled in this mode. Choose th' "Daily" option t' compete with others or yerself fer highscores.
custom: Customize yer game, choosin' from a large set o' difficulty modifiers.

welcome: A short summary o' th' help menu, and links t' more resources on th' game.
Welcome t' th' Early Access version o' Wayward!

Disclaimer: Wayward be currently in beta status and many things will change and improve over time.

This be th' help menu, which ye can use t' learn mechanics o' th' game. If ye can't come across th' information you're lookin' fer in this menu, ye can also visit th' {link(http://steamcommunity.com/app/379210/discussions/):Steam Discussion forums}.

If ye want t' keep up with Wayward, please visit th' {link(http://www.waywardgame.com):Wayward Website}, {link(http://www.reddit.com/r/Wayward):Subreddit}, or {link(https://discord.gg/wayward):Discord}.

Want t' help Wayward, savvy? Spread th' word, or follow us on one o' th' followin' sites: {link(https://www.facebook.com/waywardgame):Facebook}, {link(https://twitter.com/Wayward_Game):Twitter}, or {link(http://www.indiedb.com/games/wayward):IndieDB}.
controls: A guide on usin' th' keybindings associated with common actions in th' game, t' speed up gameplay, and other related tips and tricks.
Learn common keybinds fer th' game.
interface: How t' interact with and customize th' windows/dialogs.

Wayward uses dialogs, or windows, fer displayin' most in-game information. This means th' interface be almost completely customizable.

Ye can move th' dialogs by draggin' them by th' title bar, and ye can resize them by draggin' on their edges or corners.

Th' "static" elements on th' screen, namely, yer stats, th' menu bar, and th' list o' messages, can all be moved t' other corners or edges o' th' screen, usin' th' options in their context menus ({Bindings:MenuContextMenu}). Th' list o' messages can be put into a dialog with {Bindings:DialogMessages} or usin' th' "Show as Dialog" option in its context menu.

Th' interface setup fer each world be retained between savin' and loadin' th' game.
inventoryManagement: Learn ways o' organizin', movin', and droppin' items.

Thar be many ways t' organize and move items in Wayward.

1. __Drag and Drop__: By holdin' {Bindings:GameItemMove}, ye may drag and drop items into a container window, quickslot, equipment slot, or directly on t' th' ground. Draggin' and droppin' t' th' game screen will drop it in front o' ye, or inside a chest if ye be facin' one.

2. __Quickmovin'__: With {Bindings:GameItemQuickMove} ye can move an item instantly from yer duffle t' a container or vice-versa. Ye can use this while th' container be not open, if yer character be facin' towards it. Ye may also use {Bindings:GameItemQuickMoveAll} t' instantly move all items o' th' same type.

3. __From th' item's menu__: Ye can use {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):actions} t' drop and move items as well: namely, "Drop", "Drop All", "Move", and "Move All". Th' "Move" actions will only appear if thar be a container window open. If th' item in question be o' a {link(Menu.HelpArticle.ItemQualities):high quality}, thar will be actions fer droppin' or movin' all items o' that quality.

4. __Droppin' items__: By pressin' {Bindings:GameItemDrop}, ye may drop an item onto th' ground. If th' tile in front o' ye be blocked, nothin' will happen, or th' item will be dropped at yer feet, if yer "Drop Location" option be set t' "Drop at Feet When Blocked". Ye may also press {Bindings:GameItemDropAll} t' drop all items o' th' same type.
quickslots: Learn th' easier way t' use actions on items.
Th' easier way t' use actions on items.
fastPickup: A summary on ways t' loot items on th' ground.
A quick way t' get items on th' ground.

If thar be an item on a tile that ye would like t' loot, ye can either walk onto th' tile (if th' {link(Menu.Options.3):"Auto Loot" option} be enabled) or use th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Loot Item" action} while facin' th' tile. 

Thar can be multiple items on a tile. When ye be standin' over them, ye can press {Bindings:GameIdle} t' pass th' turn and gather th' items one at a time. Alternatively, ye can loot all th' items on th' tile by facin' th' tile, then usin' th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Loot All Items" action}.
actions: A guide on how t' interact with items, tiles, or th' things on a tile.

Openin' up th' actions menu ({Bindings:GameActions}) will brin' up a list o' actions ye can perform, usually on th' tile or object you're facin'. Some examples include collectin' fruits from plants, pickin' up {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Doodads):doodads} you've placed, and restin'. Thar be also th' "Jump" action that can help ye get out o' tight spots, but be careful when usin' it as it reduces stamina based on th' weight you're carryin'.

All items also have actions that can be performed on them. Th' item actions menu be opened by pressin' {Bindings:GameItemMenu}. Tools will usually have actions that can be used on th' facin' tile, while other items will have actions that affect th' tile you're standin' on, or just ye, such as consumin' a food with th' "Eat" action.

Since findin' an item in yer duffle and usin' th' item action menu on it can be a pain, ye can use {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Quickslots):quickslots} t' speed up th' process.
stats: Learn how t' understand and manage yer health, stamina, hunger, and thirst.
A numerical representation o' yer wellbein'.

Ye have four core stats: {#--stat-color-health:Health}, {#--stat-color-stamina:Stamina}, {#--stat-color-hunger:Hunger}, and {#--stat-color-thirst:Thirst}.

{heading:Decayin' Stats}

If yer {#--stat-color-stamina:stamina} be 0 and ye take an action, ye will lose {#--stat-color-health:health}.

When yer {#--stat-color-hunger:hunger} or {#--stat-color-thirst:thirst} tick below zero, each subsequent time they go down, yer health will be reduced by their current amount. Fer example, if ye have -4 {#--stat-color-hunger:hunger}, and it goes down t' -5, ye will lose 5 {#--stat-color-health:health}.

When yer {#--stat-color-health:health} reaches 0, ye will die.

{heading:Replenishin' Stats}
 
{#--stat-color-stamina:Stamina} replenishes slowly over time, but can also be replenished by restin', most food items, and sleepin' fer maximum benefits.
 
{#--stat-color-hunger:Hunger} and {#--stat-color-thirst:thirst} can be replenished by food and water.
 
{#--stat-color-health:Health} recovers slowly over time, but can be restored with bandages, other health items, and some types o' food.

{heading:Maximum Stats}

Usin' skills have th' chance t' increase th' maximum values o' yer stats. An increase in strength will increase th' maximum value o' yer {#--stat-color-health:health} as well as yer {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Overweight):weight limit}. An increase in dexterity will increase yer maximum {#--stat-color-stamina:stamina}. An increase in metabolism will increase both {#--stat-color-hunger:hunger} and {#--stat-color-thirst:thirst}.

Thar be also {link(Menu.HelpArticle.ItemQualities):legendary} items that can be {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Crafting):crafted} or found that will increase yer stats when equipped.
doodads: Learn about, and how t' interact with, objects placed in th' world, such as plants or structures.
A guide on plants, structures, and other objects affixed t' th' ground.

Objects attached t' th' ground like plants, piles o' rocks, furnaces, and even campfires be considered t' be a "doodad". 

T' "collect" them (pick them up), ye can do one o' th' followin':

1. While facin' th' doodad, use th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Collect Object With Hands" action}.
2. Use an item with a "Diggin'" use, such as a stone shovel.
3. Use an item with a "Carvin'" use, such as a sharp rock.
4. Use an item with a "Gather" use, such as a wooden pole.
5. Use an item with a "Harvest" use, such as a stone knife.

Usin' yer bare hands (the first o' th' above options) can sometimes harm ye. Th' other options be safe, as they use tools, but they will decrease th' durability o' that tool.
resourceGathering: A guide on collectin' items from th' environment or creatures.

T' gather resources from trees or rocks, ye must use th' "Gather" action from an item's menu. It be also recommended ye quickslot it fer quick usage. Ye may have t' default its usage as "Gather" if it be not th' default action. See {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Quickslots):Quickslots} fer more information on this functionality. Ye may not always succeed in gatherin' materials (the chances be based on yer skill and tool).

Alternatively, if ye have th' "Auto Gather/Harvest" option set, ye can simply move into resource tiles that block movement t' gather. Ye will use whatever be in yer hands t' gather. Ye can choose what tool specifically be used in either yer port or starboard hand by selectin' which t' use at th' bottom o' yer equipment menu. It be harmful t' try t' resource gather without tools.

Some resources be not gathered in this fashion. Things like small plants and other objects attached t' th' ground (referred t' as doodads) require different methods. Review th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Doodads):"Doodads" help entry} fer more information on these items.

{heading:Resource Stages}

Many plant-based resources have cycles o' growth, followin' a predictable pattern from "germinatin'" all th' way up t' "ripenin'". Every plant and fungus features unique resources at each stage o' growth. If ye attempt t' gather or harvest from a plant too early, ye may not get th' full amount o' resources. Knowin' th' steps o' growth be also important when {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Gardening):gardening}.

{heading:Gatherin' & Harvesting}

Gatherin' be a destructive process, meanin', ye will attempt t' gather everythin' from th' plant. Some vegetables and fruits require this t' get th' edible portion, such as potatoes or carrots fer example.

Harvestin' a plant will only attempt t' get what will keep th' plant alive and/or sustainable. This be not always an option fer all plants, and sometimes will only result in gettin' their seeds.
reputation: Masterin' malignity and benignity t' modify th' game's difficulty.
Learn all about reputation and its impact on th' game's difficulty.

Th' island be alive and judges yer actions. It returns in kind and unkind by modifyin' th' difficulty o' th' game. Th' lower yer reputation is, th' more malignity ye be gainin'. Th' higher yer reputation is, th' more benignity ye be gainin'. Reputation values in th' negative will result in increasin' difficulty t' creatures that spawn and their frequency. Ye will come across unique creatures and situations by modifyin' yer reputation into th' positive and negative. Thar be no optimal reputation amounts, only what be survivable and enjoyable fer yer playstyle.

If ye be interested in a fairly peaceful game, ye will want t' have a positive reputation.

If ye be interested in combat and discoverin' unique creatures t' battle, ye will want t' have a negative reputation.

Reputation be not permanent; ye be free t' modify yer reputation (and thus, th' game's difficulty) at some godforsaken time by performin' certain actions in th' game.

Some things that gain ye benignity include th' followin':

1. Plantin', waterin', and cultivatin' plants.
2. Fishin' and dredgin' seaweed.
3. Tamin', feedin', and pettin' creatures.

Some things that gain ye malignity include th' followin':

1. Gatherin' resources from trees or mountains; destroyin' them.
2. Killin' innocent or neutral creatures.
3. Gainin' stats or usin' skills that reduce reputation.

Ye can see which skills impact reputation by openin' yer skill dialog accessed with {Bindings:DialogSkills} and hoverin' over each skill. Similarly, ye can see th' impact fer craftin' items by findin' th' "Craftin' Reputation" value in th' item tooltip within th' craftin' dialog. Each action as illustrated above can also affect reputation.

Both positive and negative have maximums set at 64,000 and -64,000 respectively; however, if ye continue t' add points against this cap, th' inverse reputation will be earned.
milestones: A short guide on Wayward's achievement system.
Th' achievement system o' th' game.

Milestones be a list o' goals or achievements ye can work towards. Milestone progress be retained between characters and saves. Completin' a milestone unlocks higher startin' skills, stat points, and even more items.

Most milestones add up over time, such as "Friendly", which counts how many creatures ye tame, or "Chef", which counts how many times ye cook food. However, thar be a few milestones that simply require an amount o' somethin' t' be unlocked. Examples o' this milestone type be "Malevolent" and "Benevolent", which require yer malignity or benignity t' be at 64000.
heldItems: Usin' th' port and starboard hand equipment slots.
Understandin' th' use o' both o' yer hands.

Yer port and starboard hand equipment slots be interchangeable. Ye can equip two weapons, two tools, two shields or some godforsaken combination in between. 

Ye will notice th' options "Port Hand" and "Starboard Hand" in th' equipment dialog ({Bindings:DialogEquipment}). With both options enabled, ye will use both hands (and whatever be equipped in each slot) in combat and in gatherin'/harvestin' (with "Auto Gather/Harvest" enabled). Only one hand be used per turn, so both bein' enabled means th' hands switch off. Be careful t' disable a hand if ye don't have somethin' equipped in it, as ye could harm a hand by mistake. 

If both hands be disabled, automatic gatherin' and combat be not possible.

T' receive a parryin' defense bonus, ye must be holdin' an item in each hand (one t' parry with, one t' fight with).
crafting: A guide t' th' craftin' system: What items t' use, and affectin' th' output durability and quality.
Th' ins and outs o' smashin' materials together.

Ye can open th' craftin' dialog with th' "Craftin'" menu bar button, or with {Bindings:DialogCrafting}.

Craftin' be simple t' perform, but th' system has a lot o' depth.

__Which Items Be Used__

When hoverin' over a recipe (item) in th' craftin' window, th' items that will be used t' craft it will be highlighted with a white border. 

Ye may notice that th' recipe always uses th' first instance o' th' item in yer duffle. T' change what items be used in a craft, ye can simply change th' order o' th' items in yer duffle.

__Durability and Quality__

Th' durability and {link(Menu.HelpArticle.ItemQualities):quality} o' craftin' ingredients affects th' durability and quality o' th' resultin' item:
- Ingredients that be damaged will cause th' resultin' item t' be less durable.
- Usin' remarkable, exceptional or legendary items and required {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Doodads):doodads} increases yer chances t' craft a high-quality item. This counts fer both consumed and required items, but more so fer consumed ones.
- Th' skill used in th' craft will also factor into th' quality o' th' resultin' item. Th' higher yer skills, th' better chance at a higher quality items.
- Decayable items (such as food) also gain decay bonuses from usin' higher quality items in th' craft.

__Tiers__

Usin' higher tiered items and doodads can produce higher quality crafted items. Fer example, usin' an iron hammer versus a stone hammer or an iron anvil versus a stone anvil. Ye be able t' see which tier an item or doodad be based on its groupin' within th' tooltip o' each item or doodad.

__Unlockin' New Recipes__

Ye can come across new craftin' recipes by gatherin' th' required items in yer duffle and by findin' old instructional scrolls.
itemQualities: Understandin' th' differences between normal items and those o' quality.
Remarkable, exceptional and legendary item qualities.

Thar be three item qualities, each with differin' properties.

1. Remarkable: Outlined in a {#--item-quality-remarkable:blue} border, these items will have a slightly higher durability than normal items.
2. Exceptional: Outlined in a {#--item-quality-exceptional:purple} border, these items will have a higher durability than normal items.
3. Legendary: Outlined in a {#--item-quality-legendary:orange} border, these items will have a much higher durability than normal items and feature a unique magical property. These magical properties include such things as increased skills or stats on equippin', reduced item weight, increased weight capacity, and many more dependin' on th' item.

Besides th' bonuses t' durability, item quality will also provide bonuses t' item uses such as consumption potency, fuel values, and others dependin' on th' type o' item it is. Additionally, th' more items o' quality used in a {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Crafting):craft}, th' higher th' chance o' producin' a higher quality item is.
death: It will happen t' us all eventually. This contains information about what carries over between lives.

Death be permanent. Although ye may have died, all o' th' craftin' recipes ye have discovered will be ready on yer next playthrough. Yer {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Milestones):milestones} will also carry over, providin' ye multiple startin' benefits.

If ye be findin' th' game too difficult, learn more on managin' yer {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Reputation):reputation} which can affect th' game's difficulty.
taming: A small guide on how t' tame creatures usin' a variety o' methods.
Learn about all th' options fer tamin' creatures.

There's a variety o' methods fer attemptin' t' tame creatures in Wayward. These include:

1. Usin' th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions): "Tame" action in th' action menu} when facin' a 
creature. Th' chances o' success o' this method be quite low, especially at lower skill levels and varies dependin' on what th' creature be and their difficulty.
2. Usin' th' "Offer" option on an item when facin' a creature. If th' creature wants th' item, it will accept ye as its owner.
3. Droppin' items on th' ground and havin' creatures move over it will have them become tame towards ye (or some godforsaken player that be closest t' th' creature) if they accept th' item.

Aberrant creatures be harder t' tame and will sometimes reject ye as its owner even when offerin' items. This chance be based on yer animal tamin' skill.
gardening: Learn about th' cycles o' growth fer plant-life and tips on gardenin'.
Tips on gardenin' and information on growth cycles.

Th' full plant life cycle be represented within Wayward. In order, these be: germinatin', seedlin', vegetative, buddin', flowerin', ripenin', and dead. Fungus follows th' same steps, but be named: germinatin', spreadin', formin', youn', fruitin', and full. Each o' these stages provide different {link(Menu.HelpArticle.ResourceGathering):resources when gatherin' or harvesting}.

Ye can attempt t' water plants (by usin' th' "Pour" action on water containers) or plant them on fertile soil t' reduce their growth time. Waterin' plants will also heal them if they became damaged through harvestin' or tramplin'.

Through th' use o' fertilization, ye can promote th' fertility o' plants (spreadin' and propagation) and decrease growin' time. By combinin' compostable items t' produce compost, and makin' bone meal through th' grindin' o' bones, ye can craft fertilizer. Combine it with soil (produced when diggin' dirt) t' create fertile soil. Fertile soil can be placed down, tilled, then used as th' target fer plantin' seeds and mushrooms.
overweight: Learn th' impacts o' bein' overweight.

If ye be carryin' too much weight, ye will be "Encumbered". Th' first level o' encumbrance will slow down yer movement and reduce {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Stats):stamina regeneration}. If it progresses t' th' second level, "Overburdened", ye will take damage as ye move. 

Ye can drop items from yer duffle with {Bindings:GameItemDrop}, {Bindings:GameItemDropAll} (to drop all o' one type o' item), ye can use th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Drop" action on th' item}, or ye can drag and drop them on t' th' game screen.
merchants: Learn how t' trade and interact with wanderin' merchants.

Ye can drag items into th' wanderin' merchant's duffle t' receive barter credit. Alternatively, ye can also use th' item's menu t' trade as well. Ye can use this barter credit t' trade fer other items that ye wish t' receive in return. Ye can come back at some godforsaken time t' trade with th' merchant, but be careful, they may "wander" away fer good eventually.

Yer barterin' skill influences th' amount o' barter credit received when tradin' items; however, merchants will always trade items back at a higher value.

If ye do not wish t' trade with th' merchant, ye can also choose t' instigate an attack towards th' wanderer usin' th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Attack" option in th' action menu}. But, be careful; they won't take kindly t' such hostile actions.
gameModes: Explorin' th' different ways t' play Wayward and modifyin' th' difficulty.
Explanation o' th' different game and turn modes and difficulty in Wayward.

{heading:Game Modes}

__Hardcore__

{#--text-color-faded:Difficulty:} Medium t' High

Th' default and definitive way t' play. 
- Death be permanent. 
- {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Reputation):Reputation} can be altered via in-game actions t' dynamically modify th' game's difficulty.


__Casual__

{#--text-color-faded:Difficulty:} Low

- Dyin' will respawn ye in th' last place ye rested or slept, with yer items dropped at th' location o' yer demise. 
- Most creatures be neutral/peaceful unless attacked. 
- Reputation will still impact creature spawn types and frequency, but ye can engage with them at yer choosin'. 
- {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Milestones):Milestones} be disabled in this mode.


__Challenge__

{#--text-color-faded:Difficulty:} High

- Randomized difficulty modifiers and a unique set o' quests, intended fer quick play sessions. 
- Savin' be disabled in this mode. 
- Choose th' "Daily" option t' compete with others or yerself fer highscores. 
- Due t' th' modifiers and set o' quests that must be performed difficulty in this most will always be high regardless o' reputation.
- Only "Challenge Mode" {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Milestones):milestones} be obtainable in this mode.


__Custom__

- Allows ye t' customize yer game t' yer likin', choosin' from a large set o' difficulty modifiers.
- Some o' th' customizable aspects be features o' th' above modes (peaceful creatures, respawnin', etc.).
- {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Milestones):Milestones} be disabled in this mode.


{#--text-color-faded://Whether in Challenge Mode or Custom Mode, ye can see which modifiers be enabled with th' pause menu ({Bindings:GamePause})//}


{heading:Turn Modes}
Dependin' on if ye be playin' a single player or multiplayer game, ye can choose from th' followin' turn modes:


__Manual Turns__

{#--text-color-faded:Difficulty:} Low

Turns only pass as players perform actions (also known as "turn-based"). This mode be only available in single player mode.


__Simulated Turns__

{#--text-color-faded:Difficulty:} Medium

Turns happen automatically as lon' as player(s) be performin' actions. This mode be only available in multiplayer mode.


__Real-time Turns__

{#--text-color-faded:Difficulty:} High

Turns happen automatically as time passes. Ye can modify th' time between turns with th' "Tick Time" settin'.


{#--text-color-faded://Turn modes and other settings can be modified at some godforsaken time within th' "Modes" menu ({Bindings:GamePause})//}
multiplayer: Information on th' multiplayer system in Wayward.

Multiplayer in Wayward be enabled fer up t' 32 players. Multiplayer works on a simulated real-time mode whar each turn happens on a fixed interval. "Casual" and "Hardcore" modes work a bit differently than in single player. Casual mode allows players t' respawn as per normal, but in hardcore mode, when ye die ye will continue t' play in dredgie form, allowin' ye t' spectate but not interact normally. Multiplayer also allows fer a special PVP flag t' be set t' allow players t' hurt and kill other players. Multiplayer options can be set in th' multiplayer menu via th' pause menu accessed with {Bindings:GamePause}.

Creature spawn rates, creature difficulty, and {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Reputation):reputation} be all based on how many connected players thar be and will scale and average based on each individual player.

{heading:Commands}
Ye can use several special commands while playin' multiplayer. T' see a list o' all possible commands, type "/commands" in th' chat bar and hit enter. Th' followin' commands be also available fer use:

{#--text-color-faded:/players} — Shows a list o' all connected players.
{#--text-color-faded:/ping} — Shows yer latency t' th' host player.
{#--text-color-faded:/kick} — Allows th' host t' kick a player.
{#--text-color-faded:/banned} — Shows a list o' all banned players.
{#--text-color-faded:/ban} — Allows th' host t' ban a player.
{#--text-color-faded:/unban} — Allows th' host t' unban a player.
bugs: Did ye get an error, savvy? Please report it!
Learn how t' report bugs and debug Wayward.

Please report all th' issues ye spot! While we try t' ensure Wayward be very stable, some things fall through th' cracks. Wayward be still in beta status and our development team be very small. Therefore, without players reportin' issues, they may stay unresolved. If ye do report yer bugs, we cannot express just how much we appreciate them! 

With that bein' said, {link(https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=798938225):here be a guide on how t' report and debug issues ye have with Wayward}.

Report bugs and issues at:
1. {link(http://steamcommunity.com/app/379210/discussions/1/):Steam Discussions Bug Reports forum} OR
2. {link(https://discord.gg/wayward):Discord}
